summary: "Ulysses" is a significant novel by James Joyce, published in 1922. It follows three characters in Dublin over one day, drawing parallels to the ancient Greek story of Odysseus. The book is known for its modern writing style, including stream of consciousness. It explores themes like antisemitism and Irish nationalism but is also filled with humor and literary references. Despite some controversy, it's considered one of the greatest literary works, showcasing Joyce's innovative approach to storytelling and character development.
title: Ulysses (novel)
